meanings.definition: To outwit or outsmart someone in a plot or scheme.
meanings.sent1: She was outplotting her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The detective was outplotting the criminal in the mystery novel.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was outplotting the hunter in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her strategic mind was outplotting every move of her rival.
meanings.sent5: Outplotting requires careful planning and quick thinking.

meanings.definition: The act of devising a plan or scheme to outdo someone else.
meanings.sent1: His outplotting of the competition led to his success.
meanings.sent2: The outplotting of the villain in the story added suspense.
meanings.sent3: The outplotting of the prankster resulted in a hilarious outcome.
meanings.sent4: Her outplotting in the business world was legendary.
meanings.sent5: The art of outplotting involves strategy and cunning.
